results.description:
Title: Industrial Control Cyber Security

Presenter: Helge Janicke, Cyber Security Centre, De Montfort University

Abstract

This talk will explore major issues facing the cyber security industry, such as vulnerability, threat detection and mitigation. It will also focus on how key industries such as Water, Oil & Gas, Nuclear, Power Generation, Alternative Energy and Smart Grids can ensure they have the proper plans in place to manage the risk of cyber attacks. Joint meeting with IET East Midlands
results.name: Industrial Control Cyber Security

results.description:
Title: Current Postgraduate Research

Presenter: PhD students from local universities


Abstract

A small number of students will be selected to give an overview of their research projects. Presentations will last around 15 minutes each with 5 additional minutes for questions. The best presentation will be awarded a £50 prize. The prize will be decided by the audience and the Branch committee, and awarded on the night. Please note that the research projects being presented will be announced nearer the time by use of email and the branch website.
results.name: Current Postgraudate Research

results.description:
Title: A C++ API for Behavioural Architectures in Robotics

Presenter: Aaron Edwards, Computational Intelligence Research Student, De Montfort University

Abstract

A C++ library has been written to provide an application programming interface (API) for users to create Software Controllers for Robotic platforms. The programming methodologies used in the API are discussed, along with the capabilities of the API. The class structure and hierarchy of the API are explained in detail and future developments that are planned for the API are discussed. 

Joint meeting with IET East Midlands, IMechE and IEEE DMU Student Chapter
results.name: A C++ API for Behavioural Architectures in Robotics

results.description:
Title: Built-in not bolted-on privacy and data protection in engineering and technology projects

Presenter: Sara Wilford, Centre for Computing and Social Responsibility, De Montfort University

Abstract

Privacy by design is a concept originally proposed by Ann Cavoukian, the Information and Privacy Commissioner of Ontario, Canada.  Its objective is to be proactive rather than reactive, and preventative rather than remedial.  The development of new technologies should therefore consider building privacy protections into design and development from the outset.  Built in, rather than bolted on approaches can provide end-to-end lifecycle protection, increase visibility and transparency and respect for user privacy and data protection in the development, design and implementation of new technologies.

Joint meeting with IET East Midlands
results.name: Built-in not bolted-on privacy and data protection
